comments:
I created one EJB Project and that worked fine.
I went on to create another EJP project (without client creation) and I got 
this exception. I have ran into similar problems before too.

What i later found out that if you try to create project through the Module 
Creation Wizard it works but if you create a flexible project and then right 
click on the project and try to create a module it throws this exception

Jason,
As per our discussion this will not be fixed as a simple behavior of hte java
biulder to insure java output folders exist in the workspace. Navigator work
will insure these folders are able to be filtered

Fix released via fix from Michael and myself.  Please look to builds post 4.25
am.  However if pulling from source will be working now

causedBy.message: Path must include project and  resource name: /EjbProject
